intro: Gibbaria glabra, commonly known as the smooth gibbaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly called the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Gibbaria glabra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
